intro: Handroanthus coronatus, commonly known as the Crown of Thorns, is a flowering plant native to South America. It is a member of the Bignoniaceae family and is characterized by its striking, showy flowers that range in color from yellow to orange. The plant has woody stems and is adapted to arid environments, making it drought-tolerant. Its leaves are opposite and simple, often with a slightly hairy texture. It is widely cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its vibrant blooms and resilience.
